name: Island Shangri-La Hotel

reviews.title: Distinctly average
reviews.text: I have come to expect more from Shangri la's. Our room was very dated and on the 39th floor which means you are next to a function suite to the extent the toilets were outside our room. We complained about this to reception but they said they were full and had no other room to give us. I have no doubt this was true but the question I would ask why would they have even designed the hotel so it has rooms on a function floor? We ended up checking out a day early even though the room had been paid for and was no refundable.... This may seem a little drastic but we simply had a nicer place to stay in hong kong than a dated room next to what ever function they that on that day/night! We complained again on checkout and the receptionist did get the assistant manager who offered us another room which we declined then they took off a room service charge which was only small. They also gave us a lift to the IFC in the hotel car as a gesture.

The manager did think on his feet which I liked but in a first class hotel we were give a second class room for a four night stay I think they need to think bigger.... I want a voucher or some loyalty points!
reviews.title: Hotel and amenities great, room good not great

reviews.text: On the plus side the pool was nice and the breakfast was good but overall the stay was not a positive experience!
reviews.title: Classy great location nice fitness center

reviews.text: Two nights in Sept 2012. The hotel interior architecture is stunning, from the magnificent lobby to the atrium that starts on the 40th floor. Service was attentive and detailed. Pool and spa was very nice. The room was well appointed, but the bathroom was small with too little counter surface. There is no in-room coffee or espresso maker, and I missed that. The breakfast buffet in Cafe TOO has a mind-boggling variety of eastern and western dishes.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This really is one of the classiest places i the world to stay. The rooms are fantastic and all services are great. I always get their car from airport to start out the right way. The lobby scene is not the best but Lobster bar is good to start or for a night cap but many entertainment options are nearby. For families the park, aviary, and tram to Peak are walking distance. One can easily get a taxi or longer walk to ferry to Kowloon. There is a mall in the basement.
reviews.title: Service is Excellent But Not Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our time at shanghai-la hotel is always a pleasurable stay.
reviews.title: Favourite hotel on Hong Kong island

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is amazing wIth plenty of tables to cater for large crowds - no lining up for breakfast.
reviews.title: Luxury with sensational friendly service in Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always have a massage at the spa, really recommend it!
reviews.title: Outstanding service- couldn't fault a thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is very good, well set up for a great workout with lots of equipment - no waiting around
reviews.title: Friendliest service I've ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are large with great views
reviews.title: Great luxury hotel close to Central amenities

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in early October 2012, for business. My "Deluxe Harbour View Room" (room 4412, if I recall correctly) actually had a view of the Conrad hotel next door, but if I leaned against the glass, I could see some of the harbour.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in the centre of everything

reviews.text: That said, the hotel itself is beautiful and the standard of service from every quarter was exceptional. In-room Dining, Business Centre, Reception/Check-in, Concierge ... all consummate professionals prepared to exceed your expectations! In-room breakfast was lovely on all three days - the fact that they bring the toaster to your room, so your toast is piping hot and crunchy (not luke-warm and chewy), is a wonderful idea!
reviews.title: Well Rounded Hotel - Super Nice Gym & Spa

reviews.text: The only drawback, as with other Shangri-La resorts, is that the selection of pillows is less than ideal - only very soft (almost flat) feather pillows, or a very firm, very high poly-foam pillow (no latex/memory foam???).
reviews.title: Time-Wrapped Classic

reviews.text: The best thing I love about this hotel is its completeness/convenience - has everything on site!
reviews.title: Classy centrally located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: great,right on Pacific Place Mall/Office Complex and Admiralty Station.
reviews.title: An outstanding hotel in Hong Kong

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located by the Pacific Place which also has a subway station (Admiralty) and a HSBC branch. Pacific Place is a high end shopping center so it is not as crowded as some other place (at least the few days I was there). The hotel is accessible from a lift inside the mall. Central (the business area) and Tsim Sha Tsui (the shopping area in Kowloon) are both one stop away on the subway. Staff is polite and helpful. The concierge gave me very detailed and frank information on trips and attractions, which made my stay very enjoyable. The breakfast buffet is comprehensive with more than enough selections. The room size is generous - I was expecting something small given it's Hong Kong, but was quite pleased to see a usual US sized room that made me forget that this is Hong Kong. Pool is a little bit small though.
reviews.title: Convenient location, excellent service, delicious food, spacious room
Excellent location and service
reviews.text: Stayed at ISL from 17/10/2012-21/10/2012.

Location- Located above Pacific Place, a high end shopping mall with good selection of luxury boutiques and restaurants. Also next to Admiralty Metro Station making it very convenient to go anywhere in Hong Kong island or Kowloon. Make sure you get the Octopus Card.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel But Musty Smell in Rooms

reviews.text: Rooms- Large, well maintained bedrooms with classic decor. Very clean and no odor whatsoever.
reviews.title: Classy hotel.

reviews.text: Bathrooms- Floor to ceiling marble with L'Occitaine toiletries.
reviews.title: Very good hotel - Satisfied

description: Island Shangri-La Hong Kong is a welcoming luxury hotel in the heart of the city. It soars 56 floors above Hong Kong's most prestigious shopping, cultural and business addresses, with memorable views of the Peak and Victoria Harbour.
